articles.title: About this site
articles.description: Some additional details about the website
articles.contents:
About Me
My name is Tejas
Mundhe, an incoming sophomore at Walnut Hills High School
in Cincinnati Ohio with an interest in Data Science, Computer Science,
and Robotics. I also enjoy sports, playing video games, and reading in
my free time.
About this Project
This project, Global Internet Usage is made up of a
multitude interactive or animated plots and models. This was made as my
final project for the Stanford Pre-Collegiate Institutes Introduction to
Data Science Course.
Goals
Continue my journey into the world of Data Science
Practice making larger projects which are easily acessible
online
Practice using Distill and Modeling techniques to apply what I’ve
learned
Observe Gapminder and Country Internet data in a meaningful way

articles.title: Global Internet Usage
articles.description: Welcome to the website. I hope you enjoy it!
articles.contents:
Welcome!
Hi there. In this website I’ll be analyzing the factors which make up
a country such as GDP, Population, Internet Use Rate, and more. This
will be done through several plots from maps to faceted scatter plots.
I’ll also be predicting information about country’s using models based
off of the factors mentioned earlier. Feel free to explore the different
pages and take a look at your favorites. Enjoy!

articles.title: Internet Use Rate
articles.description: A faceted analysis of factors which contribute to a countries Internet Use Rate.
articles.contents:
A countries Internet Use
Rate is the percentage of people who use the internet inside of it.
In the plot below, we will be examining the Internet Use Rate’s
correlation with each country’s GDP Per Captia which is a measure of a
countries GDP per person.



GDP per Capita vs Internet
Use Rate
In
every continent, the GDP per Capita and Internet Use Rate are positively
correlated.

articles.title: Life Expectancy
articles.description: An animated model to view a country's life expectancy.
articles.contents:
Life
Expectancy in a particular country is the number of years somebody
can expect to live on average when born there. This is a popular metric
for determining how healthy a country is. The plot below analyzes
whether the Life Expectancy of a Country is effected by its GDP Per
Capita using animation by Year.
Country Life
Expectancy vs GDP Per Capita
As
a country’s GDP per Capita increases, the Life Expectancy does as
well

articles.title: Predictions
articles.description: Models which are used to analyze countries.
articles.contents:
The models below use Decision Trees
which are tree-like models which are used to predict the chances that a
certain event happens. Below I’ve created two decision trees which
predict whether a country is considered wealthy or populous depending on
the given factors. The number 1 is considered TRUE and the number 0 is
considered false. (Ex: USA = 1 means that it is considered wealthy)
GDP Per Capita Decision Tree
The
decision tree below predicts whether a country is considered rich based
off of factors such as its population and continent.



Population Decision Tree
This
decision tree analyzes how populated a country is based off of its GDP
per Capita, Life Expectancy, and Continent.

articles.title: Sources
articles.description: Credits and more information about the sources which were used in the making of this project.
articles.contents:
Source 1
The first source was the data set “Global
Internet Usage” from Kaggle. This allowed the creation of the
Internet Use Rate scatter plot.
Source 2
Another source which I used is the gapminder package.
This contributed towards the creation of every plot and model(to some
degree) on this website. To read more about this and use it in your own
projects see the “gapminder” hyperlink above.
Source 3
Source 3 was the rnaturalearth
package which allowed me to create the World GDP Map. To read more about
this and use it in your own projects see the “rnaturalearth” hyperlink
above.
Credits
This project was heavily inspired by plots in Preceptor’s Primer for Bayesian
Data Science. I also used much of it’s information as resources when
creating many of this website’s plots and models.

articles.title: GDP Map
articles.description: A map visualizing the GDP of countries around the world.
articles.contents:
A countries nominal GDP is the total
value of all of its goods and services. This can be helpful to provide
an economic snapshot of a certain country.
Global GDP Map
The
U.S and China have sizeable margins over the rest of the world
